page.title: 17ENERGY
page.content: Although Colinsburgh was one of the first places in the region to have gas supplies, it was also one of the first places to go "all electric".No regular gas supply is piped to any house but a few people have invested in calor gas tanks in their gardens to supply their needs.A few have oil fired central heating. Solid fuel is most popular, on its own or to supply central heating. The electric supply is by overhead power cables suspended from creosoted pine telegraph poles. These are frequently demolished by speeding traffic, thus interrupting the power supply. This is a constant source of complaint and the villagers desperately seek underground power cables,from the safety aspect as well.
